name: Time
description: The TM data type specifies the hour of the day with optional minutes, seconds, and fraction of second using a 24-hour clock notation. As of HL7 v2.3, the number of characters populated (excluding the time zone specification) specifies the precision. Time zone specification is optional.

constraints.precision: Precision determined by number of characters (excluding timezone)
constraints.timezone: Time zone offset in +/-HHMM format when specified
constraints.fractional: Fractional seconds (.SSSS) allowed for sub-second precision
constraints.v23change: As of v2.3, minutes are no longer required (changed from v2.2)

usage: Time fields in scheduling and appointment messages

generationHints.typical: Use realistic times appropriate for healthcare operations
generationHints.format: HHMM or HHMMSS are most common precision levels
generationHints.timezone: Include timezone for systems spanning multiple time zones
generationHints.precision: Match precision to the clinical or operational context

versionChanges.v22: Format was HHMM[SS[.SSSS]][+/-ZZZZ] - minutes were required
versionChanges.v23: Minutes are no longer required - format became HH[MM[SS[.SSSS]]][+/-ZZZZ]
versionChanges.fractionalSeconds: Allowed for transmitters requiring greater precision than whole seconds
